chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Victor A Tolentino Sanchez was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Victor A Tolentino Sanchez was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Victor A Tolentino Sanchez was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Dept of Corrections to collect from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account, an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

supervisions.notes: Court costs due to the Ozaukee County Clerk of Court's office during term of extended supervision on Ct. 1. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.
Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
9:06 AM Court interpreter John Vaughn - Maria Penkwitz under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Victor A Tolentino Sanchez appeared by video, in custody from the Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Julius Andriusis in court for Victor A Tolentino Sanchez. Court reviews charges/penalties thereof. Counsel waives reading of complaint and requesting preliminary hearing. Interpreter John Vaughn to appear in person for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Submit to SCRAM by 4 pm day of bail posted. Otherwise release has to occur the following business day. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Court Interpreter #247847 - 1:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Victor A Tolentino Sanchez appeared by video in custody from the Ozaukee County Jail. Atty Heather Dvoran appears as a friend of the court and is eligible for the public defender and Atty Andriusis will be appointed. Court reviews charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $15,000 cash bail. Court orders $5000 cash bail w/conditions. Atty Dvorans waives time limits and asks for a status hearing.
Arraignment scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
